docs.title: Today I Learned (TIL) - Everyday Snippets
docs.text: Welcome to the "Today I Learned" (TIL) repository! This project aims to curate a collection of handy code snippets commonly used in Python and R for Data Science purposes. Whether you're a beginner looking to explore data analysis or an experienced practitioner seeking quick reference, this repository is designed to be a helpful resource.

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text: The primary goal of this project is to provide a central repository for snippets that cover various aspects of data manipulation, visualization, machine learning, and statistical analysis in Python and R. Each snippet is intended to be concise, informative, and applicable across different data science projects.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: Feel free to navigate through the folders or sections listed in the Table of Contents to find tips and solutions related to specific languages or technologies. Each section contains markdown files with concise explanations and code snippets.

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text: Contributions are encouraged! If you have a coding tip, solution to a common problem, or a useful trick to share, please follow the guidelines in the CONTRIBUTING.md file.

docs.title: macOS
docs.text: macOS (previously Mac OS X and later OS X) is a proprietary graphical operating system developed and marketed by Apple Inc. since 2001.

docs.title: Create iCloud Drive symbolic link to Home
Disable System Integrity Protection Temporarily
docs.text:
To disable SIP, do the following:

  1. Restart your computer in Recovery mode.
  2. Launch Terminal from the Utilities menu.
  3. Run the command csrutil disable.
  4. Restart your computer.

docs.title: Enable System Integrity Protection
docs.text:
To reenable SIP, do the following:

  1. Restart your computer in Recovery mode.
  2. Launch Terminal from the Utilities menu.
  3. Run the command csrutil enable.
  4. Restart your computer.

docs.title: Reset and Remove Applications in Location Services
docs.text:
1. Start terminal and then sudo to a root shell

    sudo -s

  2. Go to /var/db/locationd

    cd /var/db/locationd

  3. Convert clients.plist to xml (editable format)

    plutil -convert xml1 clients.plist

  4. Edit the clients.plist file and remove the application. Convert the clients.plist file back to binary

    plutil -convert binary1 clients.plist

  5. Restart locationd

    killall locationd

docs.title: Delete Time Machine local snapshots
docs.text: for snapshot in $(tmutil listlocalsnapshotdates | grep -v :); do sudo tmutil deletelocalsnapshots $snapshot; done
